content.question: Which of the following was a result of the Marshall Plan?

choices.label: European colonies in Asia and Africa achieved independence.
Eastern Europe joined the Common Market.
Germany was divided into four zones, each zone controlled by one of the Allies.
The boundaries of European nations were redrawn along ethnic lines.
United States political and economic influence increased in Western and Southern Europe.

content.answer: United States political and economic influence increased in Western and Southern Europe.

skill.text: Skill 1.A: Identify a historical concept, development, or process.
